decks.notes: This deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard with spells by using cantrips and cheap spells like Gut Shot and Faithless Looting. This enables the powerful flying threats like Arclight Phoenix to be brought back from the graveyard for free. The deck also utilizes cards like Thing in the Ice and Crackling Drake to control the board and apply pressure. Overall, the key strategy is to efficiently cast spells to quickly bring back Arclight Phoenix and overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of damage.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize the combo potential of the Dredge mechanic. The deck focuses on putting cards from the graveyard into the library, then drawing and discarding to trigger the Dredge abilities of cards like Life from the Loam. This allows the player to rapidly fill their graveyard with cards like Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Thug, which can then be used to return powerful creatures like Bloodghast and Prized Amalgam to the battlefield. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a large number of creatures and take advantage of their synergies for a powerful combo finish.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Dredge mechanic to fill up the graveyard with cards like Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Thug, allowing the player to consistently bring back creatures like Prized Amalgam and Bloodghast. By using cards like Faithless Looting and Cathartic Reunion, the player can quickly fill up their graveyard and trigger abilities like Creeping Chill and Narcomoeba. The deck aims to create a powerful board presence by constantly bringing back creatures from the graveyard while disrupting the opponent's strategy.

The main idea of this deck is to utilize cards like Demonic Dread and Violent Outburst to cascade into Living End, which allows the player to return all creatures from their graveyard to the battlefield. By cycling through cards like Street Wraith and using creatures with cycling abilities, the deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard and then reset the board with a powerful board presence. Additionally, the deck includes disruptive elements like Fulminator Mage and Faerie Macabre to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up for its combo.

This deck is focused on quick and aggressive play, aiming to deal damage as quickly as possible to the opponent. It utilizes burn spells like Lightning Helix, Lightning Bolt, and Skullcrack to deal direct damage. The deck also features aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Goblin Guide, and Eidolon of the Great Revel, which can quickly reduce the opponent's life total. The inclusion of cards like Boros Charm and Searing Blaze adds versatility and removal options. The deck's mana base is built to support its aggressive strategy, with a focus on fetch lands and shock lands for consistency and speed.

This deck aims to aggressively overwhelm the opponent by utilizing the discard mechanics of cards like Goblin Lore, Faithless Looting, and Burning Inquiry to quickly fill the graveyard with cards like Hollow One, Bloodghast, and Flamewake Phoenix that can be cast for free or at a reduced cost. The powerful creatures like Tasigur, the Golden Fang and Gurmag Angler provide additional pressure on the opponent, while spells like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push help control the board and remove threats. The deck focuses on quick, explosive plays to assert dominance and win games quickly.

This deck focuses on utilizing cards that enable quick and aggressive plays in order to bring Death's Shadow onto the battlefield as a powerful threat. It includes a variety of spells and creatures that help to control the board while simultaneously lowering your own life total to pump up Death's Shadow's power. By efficiently cycling through your deck and disrupting your opponent's plans with discard spells, you aim to establish a dominant position on the battlefield and overwhelm your opponent with a hasty and massive Death's Shadow.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm and pressure the opponent early in the game with a combination of aggressive human creatures. Key cards like Champion of the Parish, Thalia's Lieutenant, and Noble Hierarch provide early pressure and buffs for the human tribe, while cards like Meddling Mage, Reflector Mage, and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also uses the Collected Company spell to find additional creatures and generate card advantage. Aether Vial and Horizon Canopy provide additional utility and consistency to keep the pressure on the opponent.

The deck focuses on playing aggressively by using cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to disrupt the opponent's hand early on, while also quickly deploying threats like Gurmag Angler and Death's Shadow to apply pressure. Cards like Snapcaster Mage and Temur Battle Rage help maximize the effectiveness of these threats, while also providing some versatility. The deck also includes a variety of removal options to deal with opposing threats. Overall, the key concept of the deck is to quickly establish a strong board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure a victory.

The main idea of this deck is to use the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant) to ramp up mana quickly and play powerful late-game threats like Karn Liberated, Wurmcoil Engine, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck focuses on control elements such as Oblivion Stone and Fog to survive until it can drop its big threats, while also utilizing cards like Sylvan Scrying and Expedition Map to tutor for its key lands. Additionally, it includes graveyard disruption with Relic of Progenitus and removal with Ghost Quarter and Field of Ruin.

The core strategy of this deck revolves around quickly reducing your own life total to power up your Death's Shadow creature while disrupting your opponent's game plan with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. Using cards like Gurmag Angler and Snapcaster Mage to apply pressure and close out the game, the deck aims to control the pace of the match and win through a combination of aggressive creature tactics and efficient removal spells. The deck also utilizes cantrips like Serum Visions and Mishra's Bauble to dig through the deck for key cards and maintain card advantage.

This deck's main focus is to quickly lower its own life total to strengthen Death's Shadow while disrupting the opponent's strategy with discard spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. It also utilizes powerful threats like Tarmogoyf and Grim Flayer to pressure the opponent. The deck includes cards like Mishra's Bauble and Street Wraith to enable card selection and efficiency, along with counterspells like Stubborn Denial to protect its key threats. The mix of aggression and disruption makes it a formidable and adaptable deck in Modern 1 vs 1 matches.

The main concept of this Arclight Phoenix aggro deck is to fill the graveyard with cards quickly to effectively bring back Arclight Phoenix and trigger Thing in the Ice's transformation. Utilizing spells like Faithless Looting, Opt, and Manamorphose to draw and discard cards while also dealing damage, this deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early on with fast creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Crackling Drake. Lightning Bolt and other removal spells help control the board while also clearing the way for powerful attacks.

The deck focuses on using creatures with abilities that synergize well together to create powerful combos and generate value. The key strategy involves using cards like Devoted Druid and Vizier of Remedies to generate infinite mana, while cards like Kitchen Finks and Eternal Witness provide resilience and recursion. Collected Company and Chord of Calling serve as ways to tutor for key creatures and combo pieces. The deck aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly while using cards like Noble Hierarch and Birds of Paradise to accelerate its game plan.

The deck focuses on aggressive plays with a Golgari color combination, using creatures like Tarmogoyf and Scavenging Ooze to overpower opponents. It also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Assassin's Trophy to control the board. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek while also generating card advantage with Dark Confidant and Tireless Tracker. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Liliana, the Last Hope provides additional value and threats to the opponent, making it a well-rounded aggressive deck.

This Golgari Aggro deck aims to quickly and efficiently disrupt the opponent's hand and board while deploying threats of its own. It utilizes a mix of hand disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, along with removal spells like Fatal Push and Assassin's Trophy to control the board. The deck also includes powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf, Dark Confidant, and Liliana of the Veil to apply pressure and finish the game quickly. Overall, the deck focuses on a proactive game plan that aims to outvalue and outpace the opponent.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence of Human creatures with the help of disruptive spells like Reflector Mage and Meddling Mage. By leveraging cards like Aether Vial and Noble Hierarch, the deck aims to play threats ahead of curve and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures like Mantis Rider and Champion of the Parish. The inclusion of Anafenza, the Foremost gives the deck an extra boost in power while also disrupting graveyard strategies. The mana base is designed to support the diverse needs of the deck while maximizing efficiency.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using efficient burn spells and aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Goblin Guide, and Eidolon of the Great Revel. The deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent by playing low-cost spells and creatures to quickly reduce their life total to zero before they can stabilize or gain control of the game. The mana base is streamlined for consistency and to support the aggressive game plan.

Utilizing the synergy of +1/+1 counters, the deck focuses on rapidly increasing the power and toughness of its creatures through cards such as Hardened Scales and Steel Overseer. This allows for a fast and aggressive playstyle, overwhelming opponents with large creatures like Walking Ballista and Hangarback Walker. The inclusion of cards like Animation Module and Arcbound Ravager further enhances the deck's ability to generate and manipulate counters, creating a versatile and challenging opponent for any Modern matchup.

This deck focuses on controlling the game and preventing the opponent from executing their game plan. It achieves this through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. The main win condition is through attrition, gradually wearing down the opponent's resources while maintaining card advantage. The deck also includes a few threats like Vendilion Clique and Snapcaster Mage for additional pressure. The goal is to delay the opponent's plays, disrupt their strategy, and eventually grind them out of resources, leading to a victory.

This deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to generate massive amounts of mana quickly. It uses a variety of colorless spells and artifacts to control the game, such as Oblivion Stone and Chromatic Star. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent while building towards powerful finishers like Wurmcoil Engine, Walking Ballista, and Karn Liberated. The inclusion of cards like Relic of Progenitus and World Breaker provides additional disruption and versatility. Overall, the deck's strategy revolves around ramping up mana and controlling the board until it can win with big threats.

The deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands to generate a large amount of mana quickly. It uses various artifacts and spells to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The win conditions include powerful creatures like Wurmcoil Engine, Walking Ballista, and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, as well as planeswalkers like Karn Liberated and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. The deck aims to control the game by managing resources and overwhelming the opponent with its powerful threats and versatile removal options.

This deck aims to win the game by assembling the Ad Nauseam combo, which involves casting the Ad Nauseam spell to draw your entire deck, then using either Lightning Storm or Laboratory Maniac to secure the victory. The deck includes a variety of cards to help dig for combo pieces, generate mana quickly, and protect the combo from disruption. The key strategy is to execute the combo as quickly and efficiently as possible while managing resources and navigating through potential obstacles from your opponent.

The deck focuses on utilizing the graveyard as a resource to quickly fill the board with creatures such as Prized Amalgam, Narcomoeba, and Bloodghast. Cards like Life from the Loam and Faithless Looting help to efficiently put cards in the graveyard while also providing card advantage. The combo potential comes from using cards like Conflagrate and Creeping Chill to deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent, overwhelming them with a flurry of creatures and spells from the graveyard. Ultimately, the goal is to win the game through a combination of graveyard recursion and direct damage.

This aggressive Hollow One deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with cards like Goblin Lore and Burning Inquiry to bring out powerful creatures like Hollow One and Gurmag Angler for cheap. Additionally, Bloodghast and Flamewake Phoenix provide recurring threats while Street Wraith helps cycle through the deck efficiently. The deck also includes efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push to clear the way for attackers, creating a high-pressure playstyle that aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly.

This deck focuses on utilizing counters to strengthen creatures and maximize their potential, combining powerful aggro tactics with the synergy of Hardened Scales. By incorporating Arcbound creatures, Steel Overseer, and Walking Ballista, the deck can quickly overwhelm opponents with escalating threats. Additionally, the inclusion of key artifact cards like Mox Opal and Welding Jar provides additional support and protection for the creatures on the battlefield. With a focus on enhancing creature strength through the use of counters and efficient mana ramping, this deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver opponents in a Modern 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on aggressive strategies, aiming to deal damage quickly and efficiently to the opponent. It utilizes a variety of burn spells like Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Searing Blaze, combined with powerful creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with early pressure and efficient removal, while using cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel to punish opponents for playing spells. By prioritizing speed and aggression, this deck aims to secure victory before the opponent can stabilize or mount a defense.

The main concept of this Aggro Red Deck Wins deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent using efficient burn spells and aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Goblin Guide, and Eidolon of the Great Revel. The deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent and close out the game before they have a chance to stabilize. The deck includes a mix of burn spells, creatures, and land cards that allow for a fast-paced, aggressive playstyle in Modern 1 vs 1 matches.
